text: hundreds of migrants walk through
Macedonia every day all hoping to reach
Western Europe these people have already
survived the deadly Mediterranean
crossing in makeshift boats we're now in
the borders between Greece and Macedonia
this is one of the biggest groups of
seats so far most of the people seen
today according to several human rights
groups Macedonia has become one of the
worst places for migrants in Europe some
people be well for four days others six
days
others 10 days and even the mcdonoughs
police are the robbers they take our
money papers and we be the seven let
their dogs to terrorize us one of them
pointed his gun at us they put us in
cars and took us towards the borders
again and then when they got us of the
cars they started to beat us I got
nothing I got no life in top of that we
get this problems in the capital scope
here the government says it's struggling
to deal with the enormous wave of
migrants passing through this year yes
there were police officers who were
suspected that they have attacked
illegal immigrants we had many police
officers charged that they were part of
this international chain of smuggling
the UN says there is an even bigger
problem for migrants in Macedonia this
is Ghazi baba the country's main
detention center for migrants the UN and
local human rights groups says it's
inhumane so this building is totally and
appropriate for keeping the the forints
- keeping illegal immigrants and it can
get worse here in the north of the
country very close to the Serbian border
many are being held for ransom by
criminal gangs
this is LuAnn a name that is repeated
with fear by migrants who have already
been to Macedonia we are told it's too
dangerous to ask questions around here
but a migrant held inside one of these
houses sent us a cry for help from his
phone yesterday the monkey you have to
give him like 300 years but I don't know
I don't know to the other half I don't
have to you know what really you know
makes me angry is that you know it's
about our girls they try to sleep with
them if you refuse they don't push you
even if you pay this is rape we learned
from locals that many migrants are held
here until they pay around 300 euros
some stay here for weeks until someone
sends them some money the Macedonian
government told the BBC
it would investigate these claims there
are also plans for a new legislation
that would allow migrants to cross the
country in 72 hours
it aims to stop police brutality and
stop traffickers but until that happens
the flow of desperate and vulnerable
people through here continues Dina
Deborah - BBC News Macedonia
